title: "2% of games in League of Legends contain any incident of racism, sexism or other abusive language"

embed.description: Getting rid of toxic and abusive environments in a game community doesn't just benefit players - it has the potential to spread and start making the entire internet a better, safer place to interact. Jeffrey Lin, head of the analytics research team at Riot, delivered this message at the Game Developer's Conference in San Francisco last week.

body:
Come on riot, I love your game but how often this server is ignored in terms of allowing the community to be so toxic is ridiculous.
Is this system going to be implemented :D or are we going to expect to see OCE toxic as ever with no punishments anywhere? So please guys help out your players and show us that you're here to make the game enjoyable on ALL servers.

#ShowOCESomeLove
